hackathon-description-text: HackDuke is about collaboration, not competition. We aim to be not just a place about building meaningful projects, but also an open forum to discuss, share and bring to life ideas that aim to make a positive impact on social issues. Look forward to working and coding alongside mentors from tech and for-impact companies!
hackathon-rules:
1) Each team has a maximum of 5 people.
2) You can enter into the maximum of 1 track and any number of API prize categories. 
3) Submit your projects by Sunday, Nov 8 at 12pm. 
4) Projects content & code must be created in entirety within this weekend at HackDuke. 
5) A beginner team is defined as a team in which all members are first time hackathoners.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Winners will get to donate $500 to a local non-profit / charity of your choice, from our list of non-profits/charities. Sponsored by Infusion.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Fitzpatrick Center for Interdisciplinary Engineering, Medicine and Applied Sciences, 101 Science Dr, Durham, NC 27705, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Submissions will be evaluated for the understanding of the community/user, understanding of the impact area, and extent to which the problem is solved or mediated. Long term usefulness of the project, polish and presentation.
Submissions will be evaluated on the implementation and the technical difficulty of the project, in the scope of how it addresses the area of impact.
